subject: Re: [junit] correct order of tests
msgSnippet: public static Test suite() { TestSuite suite = new TestSuite(); suite.addTest(new YourTests( testSomething1 )); suite.addTest(new YourTests( testSomething2 ));
messageBody:
public static Test suite() {
TestSuite suite = new TestSuite();
suite.addTest(new YourTests("testSomething1"));
suite.addTest(new YourTests("testSomething2"));
suite.addTest(new YourTests("testSomething3"));
return suite;
}

-shane

On Thursday, November 7, 2002, at 12:44 AM, Wolfgang Egger wrote:

> Servus,
>
> I have a logical hierarchy TestPlan->TestSuite->TestCase->TestProcedure
>
> I represent the last one as testSomeOperation() - methods in
> TestCase-classes within the JUnit-framework.
> Unfortunatley the TestProcedures have to be performed in a certain
> order. By default this is not ensured by the JUnit-framwork.
>
> Does anyone have some hints, what to do, to have the correct order.
> Perhaps extending TestRunner or something like that?
>
> Have a nice day
>
> Wolfgang
